from pyspark.sql import functions as F, types as T, window as W


container = 'abfss://test-container@kubastorage.dfs.core.windows.net'

bronze_dir = 'bronze/staging'
silver_dir = 'silver'
gold_dir = 'gold'

bronze_data_path = f'{container}/{bronze_dir}/{filename_no_extension}.csv'
silver_data_path = f'{container}/{silver_dir}/{filename_no_extension}'
gold_data_path = f'{container}/{gold_dir}/{filename_no_extension}'

required_cols_for_aggregation = ['county', 'policyID', 'eq_site_limit']

# Read CSV, infer schema (not perfect but does not affect the columns needed for aggregation)

df = (
    spark
    .read
    .options(header='True', inferSchema='True')
    .csv(bronze_data_path)

# Write silver dataset in delta lake format

(df
    .write
    .format("delta")
    .mode("ignore")
    .save(silver_data_path)

# If schema is appropriate for this aggregation, run and save as gold. Otherwise skip this step.

if all(required_col in df.columns for required_col in required_cols_for_aggregation):

    window = W.Window.partitionBy("county")
    agg_df = (
        df
        .withColumn("count_policyID", F.count('policyID').over(window))
        .withColumn("max_eq_site_limit", F.max('eq_site_limit').over(window)) 
        .withColumn('row_num', F.row_number().over(window.orderBy(F.col('eq_site_limit').desc())))
        .where(F.col('row_num') == 1)
        .select(
            'county', 
            'count_policyID', 
            'max_eq_site_limit', 
            F.col('policyID').alias('policyID_with_max_eq_site_limit')
        )
    )

    (agg_df
        .write
        .format("parquet")
        .mode("ignore")
        .save(gold_data_path)
    )

    mssparkutils.notebook.exit(f"Written aggregate to {gold_data_path}.")

else:
    mssparkutils.notebook.exit(f"Schema not appropriate for aggregation, skipping.")
